quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
author: Buddha

quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Once you eliminate the impossible, whatever remains, no matter how improbable, must be the truth.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

quote: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word in reality. This is why right, temporarily defeated, is stronger than evil triumphant.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure the truth.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Truth is like the sun. You can shut it out for a time, but it ain't goin' away.
author: Elvis Presley

quote: We live in a fantasy world, a world of illusion. The great task in life is to find reality.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: Truth can be stated in a thousand different ways, yet each one can be true.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: The truth will set you free, but first it will make you miserable.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: I am the Way, the Truth, and the Life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
author: Jesus Christ

quote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Truth will ultimately prevail where there is pains to bring it to light.
author: George Washington

quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
author: John Keats

quote: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Some people think that the truth can be hidden with a little cover-up and decoration. But as time goes by, what is true is revealed, and what is fake fades away.
author: Ismail Haniyeh

quote: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: Tell me I'm clever, Tell me I'm kind, Tell me I'm talented, Tell me I'm cute, Tell me I'm sensitive, Graceful and wise, Tell me I'm perfect - But tell me the truth.
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: The truth is of course is that there is no journey. We are arriving and departing all at the same time.
author: David Bowie

quote: Peace if possible, truth at all costs.
author: Martin Luther

quote: The stupid believe that to be truthful is easy; only the artist, the great artist, knows how difficult it is.
author: Willa Cather

quote: In a time of universal deceit - telling the truth is a revolutionary act.
author: Unknown

quote: The great advantage about telling the truth is that nobody ever believes it.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Sometimes the truth hurts. And sometimes it feels real good.
author: Henry Rollins

quote: A dog barks when his master is attacked. I would be a coward if I saw that God's truth is attacked and yet would remain silent.
author: John Calvin

quote: Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for the truth.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: I believe that it is better to tell the truth than a lie. I believe it is better to be free than to be a slave. And I believe it is better to know than to be ignorant.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: People will generally accept facts as truth only if the facts agree with what they already believe.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: Only enemies speak the truth; friends and lovers lie endlessly, caught in the web of duty.
author: Stephen King

quote: Betrayal is the only truth that sticks.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: A harmful truth is better than a useful lie.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: A truth that's told with bad intent beats all the lies you can invent.
author: William Blake

quote: We swallow greedily any lie that flatters us, but we sip only little by little at a truth we find bitter.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: It is always the best policy to speak the truth, unless, of course, you are an exceptionally good liar.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: The opposite of a fact is falsehood, but the opposite of one profound truth may very well be another profound truth.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: By doubting we are led to question, by questioning we arrive at the truth.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: All great truths begin as blasphemies.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The universe is transformation: life is opinion.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: A lie which is half a truth is ever the blackest of lies.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Half a truth is often a great lie.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Facts are stubborn things.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Truth is so rare that it is delightful to tell it.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: There are only two people who can tell you the truth about yourself - an enemy who has lost his temper and a friend who loves you dearly.
author: Antisthenes

quote: All the truth in the world adds up to one big lie.
author: Bob Dylan

quote: If you shut up truth, and bury it underground, it will but grow.
author: Emile Zola

quote: The words of truth are always paradoxical.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: I have a theory that the truth is never told during the nine-to-five hours.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: The absurd is the essential concept and the first truth.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Your problem is how you are going to spend this one odd and precious life you have been issued. Whether you're going to spend it trying to look good and creating the illusion that you have power over people and circumstances, or whether you are going to taste it, enjoy it and find out the truth about who you are.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: The truth. It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and must therefore be treated with great caution.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: Truth exists; only lies are invented.
author: Georges Braque
